the super class (or interface ?) Appender is loaded by TestCaseClassLoader,
the implementation RollingFileAppender by the Sun ClassLoader. 
Just an idea: Try to force initialization of log4j before
TestCaseClassLoader takes over.

public static void main(String[] args){
	//do everything for log4j
	//maybe something like:
Class.classForName("org.apache.log4j.Appender");

	junit.swingui.TestRunner.run...
}

> Ok, I've read through alot of the posts, and have a general idea of 
> what the problem is, but I can't seem to fix it. Basically, I've got 
> a test that makes calls to log4J. When I run the test, I get errors 
> like this:
> 
> log4j:ERROR A "org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender" object is not 
> assignable to a "org.apache.log4j.Appender" variable.
> log4j:ERROR The class "org.apache.log4j.Appender" was loaded by 
> log4j:ERROR [junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader@2bcd4b] whereas object 
> of type 
> log4j:ERROR "org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender" was loaded by 
> [sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader@71732b].
> log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate appender named "console".
> log4j:ERROR A "org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender" object is not 
> assignable to a "org.apache.log4j.Appender" variable.
> log4j:ERROR The class "org.apache.log4j.Appender" was loaded by 
> log4j:ERROR [junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader@2bcd4b] whereas object 
> of type 
> log4j:ERROR "org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender" was loaded by 
> [sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader@71732b].
> 
> 
> So I figured out that this is a problem with the ClassLoader doubling 
> up on log4j. I get these errors with the awtui or swingui runners. 
> The textui runner works just fine. But I'd like to use the swing 
> version. So, I went into the excluded.properties file in the 
> junit.jar, and added a line at the end for log4j. When I ran my test 
> after saving that, I get a NoClassDefFoundException. So is there a 
> way around this? What am I doing wrong? I'm using the latest 3.8.1 
> junit.jar. Thanks for any help.
